text:
“Ah, my dear fellow! Here you are … in our domain,” Porfiry said, extending his hands.

Raskolnikov sat, eyes locked on him. 

“Come, sit down, old man … or perhaps you don’t like that?” 

Porfiry smiled, but Raskolnikov felt the tension. 

He noticed Porfiry retract his hand. 

They both glanced away quickly, suspicion thick in the air.

“I brought you this paper … about the watch. Is it all right?” 

“Don’t be uneasy, it’s all right,” Porfiry replied hastily, taking the paper.

He laid it on the table, then moved it to his bureau.

“I believe you said you’d like to question me … formally … about my acquaintance with the murdered woman?” Raskolnikov stammered. 

He felt a surge of unease.

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Raskolnikov feels intense unease and suspicion during his encounter with Porfiry Petrovitch, reflecting his inner turmoil and fear.
